text: Strasburg Presbyterian Church is a historic Presbyterian church in Strasburg, Virginia, US. ==Location== The building is located at 325 South Holliday Street.Presbyterian Church (U.S.A.): Strasburg Presbyterian Church ==History== The church was built in 1830. It is the oldest church in Shenandoah County. It is also the oldest building still standing in Strasburg.Strasburg Presbyterian Church: History Its first pastor was Reverend William Henry Foote. During the American Civil War of 1861–1865, the building was used as a hospital for the Confederate States Army and the Union forces. There is an adjacent cemetery which contains Confederate soldier graves.Strasburg Heritage Association A school building was added to the church in 1926. The church building survived a fire in 2011.Josette Keelor, Strasburg Presbyterian thankful for support from community after fire, The Layman, November 25, 2013 ==References== Category:Presbyterian churches in Virginia Category:Buildings and structures in Shenandoah County, Virginia Category:Churches completed in 1830 Category:Military history of the Confederate States of America Category:Confederate States of America cemeteries Category:1830 establishments in Virginia
title: Strasburg Presbyterian Church
